channel.title: The CIA
channel.description:
[url=http://www.theonion.com/content/node/43014]CIA Realizes It's Been Using Black Highlighters All These Years[/url]
LANGLEY, VA—A report released Tuesday by the CIA's Office of the Inspector General revealed that the CIA has mistakenly obscured hundreds of thousands of pages of critical intelligence information with black highlighters. According to the report, sections of the documents— "almost invariably the most crucial passages"—are marred by an indelible black ink that renders the lines impossible to read, due to a top-secret highlighting policy that began at the agency's inception in 1947.

item.title: The CIA
item.dc:creator: @Bree Bree
item.description:
@Bree wrote:

It makes you wonder why we trust these ppl with top secret information.

Read full topic

item.title: The CIA
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:5, topic:174799”][quote author=ThatOneServer link=topic=235256.msg2005998#msg2005998 date=1200879307]

You do realize that The Onion is a fake news newspaper, right?

Yeah, but this article may be true!

!!!
[/quote] Try googling it and see if it comes on any other news sites.
No? then its not true.

What I meant was, the fact that when the CIA releases documents, it blacks out much of the important information, so perhaps, they really meant to highlight the important information.[/quote]

no they dont.

Read full topic

CIA Realizes It’s Been Using Black Highlighters All These Years

LANGLEY, VA—A report released Tuesday by the CIA's Office of the Inspector General revealed that the CIA has mistakenly obscured hundreds of thousands of pages of critical intelligence information with black highlighters.

According to the report, sections of the documents— “almost invariably the most crucial passages”—are marred by an indelible black ink that renders the lines impossible to read, due to a top-secret highlighting policy that began at the agency’s inception in 1947.
